H0.text: Who was the first Astronomer Royal. Isaac Newton

H1.text: Who was the first Astronomer Royal. Edmond Halley

H2.text: Who was the first Astronomer Royal. Galileo Galilei

H3.text: Who was the first Astronomer Royal. Flamsteed

A4.text: Although Flamsteed is widely considered the first Astronomer Royal, he was never appointed with the title and only referred to in the Warrant to Ordinance as 'Our Astronomical Observer'.

A5.text: The post was created by Charles II in 1675, at the same time as he founded the Royal Observatory, Greenwich. He appointed John Flamsteed
